snippet: A new report from the Institute for Safe Medication Practices found only about half of reports of serious side effects submitted by manufacturers met basic standards for completeness.
abstract: Institute for Safe Medication Practices study finds only about 50 percent of reports of dangerous side effects submitted by drug makers meet basic standards for completeness; Food and Drug Administration uses information to track problems with medications once they enter marketplace.
lead_paragraph: A new report from the Institute for Safe Medication Practices found only about half of reports of serious side effects submitted by manufacturers met basic standards for completeness.

headline.main: Drug Makers’ Data on Side Effects Is Called Lacking in a Report
headline.print_headline: Drug Makers’ Data on Side Effects Is Called Lacking in a Report
